claims.summary: Claude Sonnet 4.5 has improved recognition of overtly malicious attempts due to implemented mitigations, which were not present in Claude Sonnet 4.
claims.evidence_span: Claude Sonnet 4.5 had perfect recognition of overtly malicious attempts with mitigations, an improvement over Claude Sonnet 4.

claims.summary: The model's performance on dual-use cases improved with mitigations, showing higher success rates compared to its predecessor.
claims.evidence_span: The presence of mitigations also improved performance on dual use cases, with Claude Sonnet 4.5 demonstrating notably higher success rates.

claims.summary: Claude Sonnet 4.5 was evaluated against an external red-teaming benchmark, showing the lowest rate of successful prompt injection attacks among tested models.
claims.evidence_span: On the attacks included within the benchmark, Claude Sonnet 4.5—with and without extended thinking enabled—had the lowest rate of successful prompt injection attacks of any model tested.

claims.summary: The evaluation for Model Context Protocol (MCP) tested the model's resilience against adversarial content, showing improved attack prevention scores with safeguards.
claims.evidence_span: The prompt injection evaluation for Model Context Protocol (MCP) tested Claude’s resilience when interacting with simulated email, Slack, and document collaboration servers that contain adversarial content.

claims.summary: The model's defenses against prompt injection attacks are being strengthened by expanding evaluation sets and incorporating adversarial fine-tuning techniques.
claims.evidence_span: Informed by external security and red-teaming partners, we continue to strengthen our prompt injection defenses by expanding upon these evaluation sets with more realistic attack scenarios.
